programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: As the team works to solve a deadly shooting in Burnside, Atwater realizes he has a very personal connection to the case.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mike Hammer is hired to investigate a toxic chemical dump in the Hudson River by Patrick Dean, the man accused of the crime. Hammer is no fan of tabloids, but his sleuthing uncovers new headlines of his own. While looking to clear his name, the journalist who broke the story and incriminated Patrick is found dead. Now, Hammer starts to suspect that his client might not be as clean as he claimed to be.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: The virtual world has real consequences in Mike Hammer's latest case. Mike Hammer is offered a case by the worried grandmother of a missing young woman. Tamara had been working as a model for a racy website before her disappearance, and when Hammer's team discovers a snuff film posted online, he worries that she may have been victimized by something much more serious. Mike Hammer is on the case to either find Tamara, or bring her murderers to justice.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mayron Hughes may be one of the most sought after basketball players in the country, but the mysterious death of his former agents could threaten everything. The star athlete hires New York's most valuable private eye in order to prove his own innocence. The case becomes increasingly complicated, and the Hammer must look at an entire roster of suspects in order to find the real killer. From Mayron father to his new agent to Mayron himself, anyone could be the culprit.

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: Three of NASCARs Rising stars are thrown into the fire as they take on the most famous and dangerous track in America - Daytona to kick off the season. Go deep inside the lives of Rajah Caruth, Jesse Love, and Carson Hocevar as they prepare for the biggest race of the season. Who will triumph and who will crash and burn?

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: After his disastrous day at Daytona, Carson Hocevar changes his tune and dazzles the NASCAR world with his aggression in Atlanta. Learn more about where Rajah Caruth comes from as well as his philosophy on the peaks and valleys of a NASCAR season. Jesse Love prepares for his NASCAR cup debut on the golf course with fellow driver Connor Zilisch.

programme.title: Meli
programme.desc: Forced to take desperate measures to save her family, a young woman robs a stranger's home, unknowingly targeting someone far more dangerous.

programme.title: Just Can't Leave You Alone

programme.title: Game of Cards
programme.desc: When data analyst Nicole Tucker's car is broken into and a mysterious military-issued card tied to her family legacy is stolen, she's thrust into a dangerous game of betrayal.

programme.title: The Comeback
programme.desc: A couple moves with their daughter back to Atlanta, their hometown. They remember exactly why they left when an old flame and family issues resurface.

programme.title: The One That Got Away
programme.desc: An engaged man reconnects with his vengeful ex, who has a sinister plan in place to destroy him and ruin his future with his bride-to-be.

programme.title: Office Secrets

programme.desc: An escaped convict uses a cryptic message to lead the FBI on a twisted trail of revenge.

programme.title: The F.B.I.
programme.desc: Inspector Erskine pursues a brilliant aerospace engineer who uses his talents for criminal purposes.

programme.title: The F.B.I.
programme.desc: Inspector Erskine goes undercover as a blind electronics expert to thwart an international intelligence ring.

programme.title: The F.B.I.
programme.desc: Erskine finds heist plans by a math genius turned criminal.

programme.desc: The laugh-out-loud funny stand up comedian focuses his special on the hilarious highs and relatable lows of everyday married life.

programme.desc: The comedian discusses his lifes difficulties including addiction, bankruptcy, and how to overcome tragedy by making lemonade out of lemons.

programme.desc: After spending over four decades delighting audiences, the renowned comedian takes the stage for the last time in his farewell stand-up special.

programme.title: Jimmy O. Yang: Guess How Much?
programme.desc: Yang dives into love languages, loser friends and negotiating with his Asian parents.

programme.title: Jimmy O. Yang: Good Deal
programme.desc: The Silicon Valley star uses his debut stand-up special to discuss tall women, disappointing his parents, and how he learned English from rap videos.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Spark of Insanity
programme.desc: Jeff and his felt friends Walter, Melvin the Superhero Guy, Peanut, and others share their latest and greatest thoughts about our times.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Minding the Monsters
programme.desc: The comedian and ventriloquist extraordinaire, along with this felt friends, visits a haunted house where hilarious chaos ensues.

programme.desc: Previously unseen stand-up comedy by Jeff Dunham; sketches that include popular characters; Brad Paisley performs; special appearances by comic Chris Parnell and former UFC champion Chuck Liddell.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: I'm With Cupid
programme.desc: Ventriloquist and stand-up comedian Jeff Dunham performs an all-Valentine's Day-themed special.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: All Over the Map
programme.desc: A comedy set and travelogue by comedian Jeff Dunham as he and his ventriloquists dummies perform globally from Iceland and London to Israel.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Controlled Chaos
programme.desc: The ventriloquist comedian provides fresh, hilarious material with his favorite puppets; Walter, Peanut, and two brand new characters.

programme.title: Kevin Smith: Silent But Deadly Extended Edition
programme.desc: Kevin Smith is anything but quiet in this new comedy special that was recorded an hour before his heart attack in February; before he nearly died backstage, onstage he discusses his marriage, his kid and his work (or lack thereof).

programme.title: Iliza Shlesinger: War Paint
programme.desc: Iliza Shlesinger performs her first stand-up special in her hometown of Dallas, Texas.

programme.title: Jim Gaffigan: Noble Ape
programme.desc: The stand-up comedy star describes how his wife faced a medical crisis, and he attempted to hold down the fort for their five children.

programme.title: Jim Gaffigan: Quality Time
programme.desc: The comedian discusses why we arent honest about not wanting to attend events, lying to children, and so much more in this hilarious special.

programme.title: Tom Segura: Completely Normal

programme.title: Slut in a Good Way
programme.desc: A woman bands together with her female colleagues to enact a sex strike as a way to teach her game-playing male co-workers a lesson.

programme.title: Larry the Cable Guy: Remain Seated
programme.desc: Larry the Cable Guy is back to "Git R Done" in his latest solo special from the Rialto Square Theater in Joliet, IL.

programme.title: Mary Lynn Rajskub: Live From the Pandemic
programme.desc: Mary Lynn Rajskub takes the stage -- her garage, to try to make sense of her career and home life.

programme.title: More Funny Women of a Certain Age

programme.title: Sasheer Zamata: Pizza Mind
programme.desc: Sasheer Zamatas "Pizza Mind" will give viewers food for thought. In this all-new stand-up special, Sasheer covers a spectrum of topics, from drugs to relationships, Disney racism to politics _ nothing is off limits. This multi-talented comedian incorporates different performance elements to express her opinions and dive into her personal life, truly giving you a piece of her mind.

programme.title: Eddie Griffin: Undeniable
programme.desc: Eddie Griffin brings his blunt and undeniable style to this stand-up set about athletes and racial stereotypes, relationships, and human mistakes.

programme.title: Eddie Griffin: You Can Tell 'Em I Said It

programme.title: D.L. Hughley: Reset

programme.desc: Comedian D.L. Hughley comments on current political events and hot topics, from marijuana legalization to the advantages of intrusive white neighbors.

programme.desc: An elderly woman is driving when she's overcome with shooting pains and crashes her car. She's rushed to the hospital, but the doctors find nothing wrong. Can Dr. G find the cause of death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. Farley discusses the bizarre case of a pregnant mother who suddenly dies. As the autopsy unfolds, Dr. Farley uncovers information that could have saved her and her unborn child's life.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: 69-year-old widower, Ernesto Vasquez is found dead on his porch with a loaded gun, a knife and three empty pill bottles.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A neighbor hears odd sounds coming from the next apartment. When police arrive, they find a man bruised and dead. When all signs point to foul play, it's up to Dr. G to find proof of murder.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A woman is killed in a drunk driving accident. At first, her death seems to be an open-and-shut case, but Dr. G discovers clues that the woman may have played a key role in her own death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: After suffering an apparent seizure, 37-year-old Ruben Delgado is found lifeless by his girlfriend.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When Marie Allen visits her sister, she makes a gruesome discovery: the 49-year-old is dead on the couch. Now, it's up to Dr. G to figure out if this was an accident or something sinister.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Even with many leads, including an insulin overdose, a tooth infection and chronic lupus, the pieces don't add up in the case of a woman's death. Will Dr. G be able to uncover the truth?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A hotel clerk calls 9-1-1 complaining of severe facial trauma, but he has no recollection of what happened and dies soon after. Police are counting on Dr. G to aid them in this investigation.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A hiker stumbles across a man's dead body in the woods. The victim's brother is convinced he was murdered. Dr. G must get to the bottom of this case. Was foul play really involved?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must determine if a teen boy died by taking his own life, but the autopsy leads to a more shocking and tragic conclusion.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A woman fears the worst when her aunt stops answering her calls. When her greatest fear is confirmed, Dr. G must determine one thing: was this a fatal fall?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: All circumstances point to foul play in the case of a dead hunter and the police fear that a killer is on the loose. Dr. G must provide them with answers before there are more victims.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A florist meets with clients for an upcoming wedding, but she suddenly collapses to the floor. With no apparent cause of death, Dr. G worries that this case may go unsolved.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: As each lead turns cold in a gruesome murder case, Dr. G worries justice may never be served. As the autopsy draws to a end, Dr. G uncovers a shocking clue that may solve this crime.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When Dr. G receives Lea Conrad's body, she suspects the woman may have died from an antihistamine overdose. Then, Dr. G learns that Lea was being treated for lupus.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A 71-year-old man wakes in the middle of the night, gasping for air. Paramedics rush to save him, but it's all in vain: he's dead by the time they arrive. What caused his death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Paramedics respond to a mother in distress: one of her infant twin girls hasn't woken up. By the time help arrives, it's too late. But there is no apparent cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: 45-year-old Natalie, who's visiting her sister from Australia, is found dead the morning after a heated argument with her estranged brother-in-law. Dr. G suspects foul play and she must race against the clock to give the police and Natalie's family the answers they need.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A mother of infant twins notices that her son is not breathing. EMTs attempt to revive him, but it's too late. Now, Dr. G must work fast to determine if the other twin's life is in danger.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G has a challenge on her hands: a victim's body spent days decaying before it was found, and decomposition could get in the way of her investigation.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An otherwise healthy child had been complaining of stomach pains. Could the medicine his mother had recently given him be to blame? Or could his death be from something more sinister?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Keith Douglas is met with a barrage of bullets as he opens his door. The police are looking to Dr. G for hard evidence to link certain suspects to the murder.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: In a bizarre scene, 44-year-old Olga Petrova is found severely burnt in her home after a heated argument with her fianc. Police want to question him and find out what happened, but he's nowhere to be found.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Roy Cambells is found dead and covered with scratches, his aggressive 80lb dog by his side. Dr. G wonders if the dog could have been responsible for the man's death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dario Romano is found dead by his son at the bottom of the attic ladder. What happened to this 45-year-old? With Dr. G's guidance, Dr. Stephany must solve the mystery.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police discover the dead body of Andrew Hopper clutching a syringe and covered with blood. The body is in Dr. G's hands, as are the clues to solving the case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When Dr. G receives Lea Conrad's body, she suspects the woman may have died from an antihistamine overdose. Then, Dr. G learns that Lea was being treated for lupus.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When an infant dies under mysterious circumstances, the young parents are prime suspects. Dr. G discovers several clues that bolster the child abuse theory, but the case is not clear cut.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: 101 Ways To Leave A Gameshow UK
programme.desc: One by one, contestants are ejected from the game in the most crazy and outrageous ways possible.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam Gods Gift Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isnt enough for you then youll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, the North of the country takes on the South in a battle to win the coveted trophy.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk training comes into play.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Twenty foolhardy Brits attempt to conquer the purpose-built obstacle course in Argentina.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In the first episode of season 3, Richard Hammond introduces a brand new challenge called Crash Mountain.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard Hammond hosts another episode of TV's stupidest, brightest and most insane game show.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Contestants face different games like The Qualifier, The Crash Mountain, Dizzy Dummies and The Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: The Qualifier sees the return of an old favourite, the Big Red Balls.

programme.title: The Almost Impossible Gameshow
programme.desc: Comedy duo The Rubber Bandits provide anarchic commentary and their own twisted, surreal take on the action.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This time the 'Dodgeball Men' are back to make 'The Qualifier' game an even bigger challenge for contestants.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Some of the obstacles the contestants face are the Bouncy Balls and The Sweeper.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the first 'Celebrity Special' of the season.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Its no doubt that the Ball Crusher Sweeper is the star of tonights show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this weeks Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Dirty Balls, The Wall Swing, The Crusher, Crazy Beams and Big Donuts are among some of the over-the-top obstacles included in this weeks episode.

programme.title: 101 Ways To Leave A Gameshow UK
programme.desc: One by one, contestants are ejected from the game in the most crazy and outrageous ways possible.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: You will see how ten celebrities get wet and repeatedly face tough obstacles in order to win the grand final.

programme.title: Total Wipeout

programme.title: 101 Ways To Leave A Gameshow UK
programme.desc: One by one, contestants are ejected from the game in the most crazy and outrageous ways possible.

programme.title: 101 Ways to Leave a Gameshow
programme.desc: More unsuspecting contestants, all competing for a 10k pound prize, are dropped, fired and dragged screaming.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bons Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australias very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns dont come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of violent love, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard Hammond, Amanda Byram, and the Big Red Balls are back!

programme.title: The Almost Impossible Gameshow
programme.desc: Another episode of the game show in which 50 members of the public compete - with almost no chance of winning.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Its Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring Worlds Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.desc: A shipwrecked couple get rescued by a strangely deserted ship, where a deranged doctor wants to use them as incubators for a giant spider's eggs.

programme.title: Maniac Cop III: Badge of Silence
programme.desc: A young female cop is framed for murder. She falls in love with the Maniac Cop, who seeks out justice for her, no matter the cost.

programme.title: Stonehearst Asylum
programme.desc: An Oxford University grad is horrified by the staff at a mental asylum he works for who are performing horrific and inhumane experimental treatments.

programme.desc: A chemical dump in a citys sewer transforms a baby alligator into a giant killer-reptile that can only be stopped by a detective and a Cajun hunter.

programme.title: Raging Sharks
programme.desc: A bizarre outbreak of shark attacks leave the crew of an underwater outpost in desperate trouble, while a Navy submarine delivers fresh dangers.

programme.title: Flight 666
programme.desc: Passengers and crew on an international flight are attacked by unseen forces that might be more or less deadly than one of their fellow travelers.

programme.title: Eye See You
programme.desc: After witnessing a brutal scene on the job, a shaken cop checks into a rehab clinic, where he finds his fellow patients are being murdered one by one.

programme.title: The Vault
programme.desc: Forced by desperate circumstances, two sisters rob a bank and are given instructions to check an old vault, where something dark resides.

programme.title: The Music Box
programme.desc: An orphaned six-year-old is caught under the spell of a mysterious music box and its up to her aunt to save her before the last note plays.

programme.title: Zoombies
programme.desc: When a rapidly spreading virus turns animals of a safari park into the undead, those left inside must stop them before they zombify the whole city.

programme.title: An American Werewolf in Paris
programme.desc: An American tourist finds himself becoming involved with a French woman who also happens to be able to supernaturally turn into a werewolf.

programme.title: Spiders
programme.desc: A spaceship bearing a mutant spider falls to the desert, where a curious reporter must warn the world about the deadly creature before it's too late.

programme.title: Wolvesbayne
programme.desc: When a vampire clan seeks to restore ancient evils, a posse of vampire hunters, led by Jacob Van Helsing and a newly-turned werewolf, must stop them.

programme.title: Zombie Night
programme.desc: As night falls, the dead rise. The people of a small town must fight to survive. With Anthony Michael Hall.

programme.title: Charlie's Farm
programme.desc: Ignoring warnings, four friends head into the Australian outback to visit the site where a violent family met their end at the hands of an angry mob.

programme.title: House of Bones
programme.desc: A psychic and a team of TV ghost hunters travel to New Orleans to investigate a haunted house rumored to be the site of paranormal activity.

programme.title: Dario Argento's Trauma (Broadcast Edit)
programme.desc: In this heart-pounding Italian thriller, a young man tries to help an escaped psychiatric patient find the serial killer who murdered her parents.

programme.title: A Deadly Lullaby
programme.desc: Six months ago, two baby girls were born at the same time at the same hospital. Olivias diedbut the baby belonging to her husbands boss survived.

programme.title: Hollow Creek
programme.desc: A popular horror novelist heads to spooky Appalachia in search of inspiration, and becomes the prime suspect in a missing person case.

programme.title: Nightbreed
programme.desc: Aaron Boone (Craig Sheffer) is haunted by terrifying nightmares of a city of monsters. He goes to see a psychiatrist, Dr. Decker (David Cronenberg), for help. But what Boone doesn't know is that Decker is really a serial killer. Decker frames Boone to take the fall for his murders, and Boone is killed by the police. But Boone is brought back to life by the monsters of his dreams, the Nightbreed, who in turn join Boone in his quest to stop Decker from killing again.

programme.title: Hammer House of Horror
programme.desc: Murder victims are being found with the hearts cut out. A police detective is assigned to find and stop the killer.

programme.title: Hammer House of Horror
programme.desc: A married couple, lost in the woods, stumble across a creepy mansion and its inhabitants - an overly-kind old women and deadly wolf children that scour the country-side looking for victims.

programme.title: ALTER Files
programme.desc: Cinematic and socially conscious, a horror showcase that lodges into your psyche.

programme.title: ALTER Collection
programme.desc: A monster lives inside every animal and no one is safe from the creep underneath.

programme.title: House on Haunted Hill
programme.desc: An eccentric millionaire invites five people to spend a night at his haunted mansion. They'll each receive a $10,000 reward provided they survive.

programme.title: Summer of 84

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In this Christmas edition, the team celebrate the festive season from a gardener's point of view. At Longmeadow, Monty and Rachel have a good clear up. Monty rejuvenates his rhubarb patch, introducing a local Herefordshire heritage variety apple tree to his orchard. Meanwhile, Carol discovers some of Britain's best winter walks and Rachel gets some tips on how to make beautiful Christmas decorations for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on the plants that need winter protection and thinks ahead to colourful spring bouquets. The glory of summer may be over in most gardens, but Carol goes to Worcestershire in search of some autumn colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Charge your glasses as Joe Swift visits a `drinkable' allotment in London where much of the produce is grown to make beer, wine and cider. In the first of a five-part series about botany, Carol Klein looks at the capsules of potential that herald the start and end of most plants' lives: seeds.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty helps two families create dream gardens that are as much for the children as for the adults. In Doncaster, Nikki and John want a garden full of edible plants and fruit.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty faces some of the most surprising plans yet - a Norwegian garden complete with waterfalls to be fashioned out of a tiny back yard in Dorset, and nothing less than a Japanese tea garden to be created out of a patch of ground in Bromley.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels from the north west coast of Scotland to the north east coast of England, from historic reconstructions to modern re-inventions. He visits some of the most inhospitable places in the country and finds gardens that are flourishing.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across some of the country's landscapes, heading across the north of England to Northern Ireland. Here, Monty sees the ingenuity, passion and determination of British people to garden and create gardens, no matter what the canvas.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the middle of the country, from Wales to Norfolk. He comes across gardens for gnomes, much-loved, well-tended allotments and extravagant gardens that bankrupted their owners.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the most densely populated part of the country, London and the home counties. He visits some of London's gardens, including a special one on a barge, as well as a beautifully restored garden close to where he grew up in Hampshire.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the south west of the country to visit some of Britain's most exotic gardens. On this journey, Monty also goes to some of the country's most historic gardens, as well as some challenging contemporary ones.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn gathers momentum, it's time to start putting the garden to bed for winter. Monty Don has some timely advice on what to do. Carol Klein meets a nurseryman in Herefordshire and together they indulge in the beauty of the Japanese maple.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As well as looking at the changes to his garden that have taken place over winter, Monty Don reveals how to plant bare-rooted raspberries in his renovated fruit garden and gets his secateurs out to rejuvenate an overgrown winter flowering honeysuckle. Plus, Monty recommends jobs for the weekend to ensure that all our seeds, seedlings and plants get off to the best possible start.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the official start of spring and Mothering Sunday only days away, Monty Don and the team look at the practical ways to achieve a better looking garden at this busy time of year. Monty is selecting and planting climbing roses at his garden in Herefordshire and gives plenty of advice on how to get them to thrive.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the clocks move forward, the longer days of spring are welcomed by every gardener. It's a busy time in the garden and the longer daylight hours present a great opportunity to get on with larger gardening projects. Weather permitting, Joe will join Monty in his garden to get to grips with lining his newly created pond giving plenty of advice for anyone wanting to use water in the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the garden growing apace, Monty shows us how we can take advantage of the new growth of all sorts of perennials, and begins by taking cuttings from emerging Delphiniums in his border and also from a pot grown plant. He also demonstrates the best way of planting Clematis against a wall to ensure a profusion of summer flowers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's Easter and the biggest gardening weekend of the year. The team give plenty of advice and inspiration - from large projects to tackling weeds. At Longmeadow, Monty is getting started on the vegetable plot, where he recommends a palette of potatoes for delicious summer crops. He also returns to his newly created pond, where he is showing how to conceal the liner with an attractive edge.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The successes and failures of all our gardens begin with the humble seed. This show is packed with know-how about how to sow a seed and ideas about how you could improve your garden this summer. Monty starts by sowing tender vegetables like cucumbers and courgettes which, from unpromising beginnings, will provide a fruitful summer. Plus, Carol gives a masterclass on successful seed sowing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: If you have a shady spot in your garden which is bereft of flowers, then Monty Don has some great suggestions of stalwarts which not only thrive in those tricky conditions, but return year after year. He is also working in the vegetable plot giving his tips on what to sow and plant out now. Meanwhile, Carol Klein discovers the pulmonaria, growing prolifically in the woodlands and verges of the New Forest.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With plenty of advice and tips on how and what to plant in a pond, Rachel de Thame joins Monty at Longmeadow to give a helping hand. Monty also gets up to date with all the seasonal jobs in the jewel garden. Meanwhile, Carol follows the trail of one of spring's brightest plants to an allotment in South Yorkshire and a man who has amassed a national collection of euphorbias there.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from the Malvern Spring Show where Monty Don, Carol Klein and Rachel De Thame bring the very best that the show has to offer. From planting and design in the show gardens, to new and exciting varieties in the floral marquee, they search out beautiful and innovative ideas to draw inspiration from.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Longmeadow with inspirational ideas and plants gathered at the Malvern Spring Show. He has tips and advice for planting bearded irises and then turns his attention to the pond where he shares ideas on different types of water lilies and how to plant them. Meanwhile, Carol Klein delves into the quirky world of ferns, discovering them in the wild and admiring their variety.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don grows a plant he's never tried before, loofahs. He also celebrates some of his favourite tulip combinations and plants out crocosmia. Joe Swift visits a garden, created by an award-winning designer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows how almost anything that holds soil and drains water can be used to grow seasonal veg, salad crops and herbs. Frances Tophill visits some hardy gardeners on the Isle of Man.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As well as looking at the changes to his garden that have taken place over winter, Monty Don reveals how to plant bare-rooted raspberries in his renovated fruit garden and gets his secateurs out to rejuvenate an overgrown winter flowering honeysuckle. Plus, Monty recommends jobs for the weekend to ensure that all our seeds, seedlings and plants get off to the best possible start.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Join Dan Cabela as he travels across Argentina to see how scientists and hunters are working together. From region-wide bird surveys to the incredible conservation work being done on the critically endangered huemul deer, this beautiful country has no shortage of fascinating stories.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela is on a mission to better understand how wild-harvested protein contributes economically and culturally to society in North America. Join him as he learns more about the Wild Harvest Initiative and sets out to harvest his own food for the freezer.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Travelling to Vancouver Island, Dan Cabela meets with tribal leader Chief Cootes to learn more about how the careful management of black bears offers economic benefits while maintaining cultural importance to his community.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Famous for its Mayan ruins, the Yucatan in Mexico is home to a diverse array of wildlife. After years of over-harvesting and exploitation, regulated hunting is helping to conserve large areas of this fragile ecosystem. Dan Cabela travels to the region to find out more.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: While releasing a defeated tarpon healthy after an epic battle is the ultimate victory, everything else is measured in heartbreak and degrees of failure. For Justin, putting Ethan on his first silver king requires patience and a tasty diversion by a local chef.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith learns the value of the Trash Can Slam on a flounder trip withCapt. Justin that turns into a multi-species challenge.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin Leake and Meredith McCord divert attention from whats not happening with the tarpon bite to using CoastMaster, light tackle and experience to find snapper success on heavily fished public spots.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When the Bay Point Billfish Open returns, we hop on board the Ellie B for some offshore competition and follow the events epic dockside party.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The LK crew returns to Guatemala with more friends for our yearly dose of world class fishing! Year after year, Casa Vieja Lodge continues to impress with daily shots at sailfish, marlin, mahi, and tuna. Tag along on our 2nd annual group trip for a tropical fishing experience like no other!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Heavy hearts find comfort in cherished memories as the Local Knowledge crew mourns the loss of one of the greatest members of the fishing industry. Looking back on several of our episodes with our dear friend Dave Salazar, we celebrate the life of this amazing fishermen, family man, and visionary behind the world renowned Casa Vieja Lodge.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Odyssea Sportfishing family grows as Casey Villone comes aboard as Rush's new deck hand. While Rush gained a helping hand on his charters, he also scored a new "Fishing Mate" who is always game to bend a rod. With a day off and a report of Tuna offshore, the two head out to see if they can beat the sharks and land a Key West sushi dinner.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush teams up with longtime friend and fellow angler Jesus Diaz for a well-earned "busman's holiday" in the beautiful waters of Key West. Even on a day off, these two can't resist seeing what's going to bite. Taking the wind and the tides into account, the duo maps out a strategic circuit through Key West's surrounding waters to target cobia, grouper, snapper, and tuna for a busy day "off" work.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Water quality is everythingand the Star brite - SeaSafe team is back at it for the second year in a row! Led by Cory Redwine, Conservation Director of Project SeaSafe, this is the 4th Annual Clean Water Collective and its bigger than ever. This time, were in Grant, Florida, where 4 million clams are being released into the Indian River Lagoon, paired with the planting of thousands of mangroves, oyster work by CCA and trash clean ups to help restore one of Floridas most critical ecosystems. But its not just about hard workits about connection. With local captains, fishing legends, and the Local Knowledge crew on hand, we hit the water to show why this place is worth fighting for. From clam drops by drone, to in-water mangrove planting, to monster snook catches, this is hands-on conservation at its best. This two-part series kicks off with action, heart, and the kind of hope only a healthy waterway can bring. Dont miss Part 1where conservation meets community and everyone gets their hands wet.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As part of this year's Star brite Sea Safe event, we hit the water to experience some of the incredible fishing the Indian River Lagoon has to offer. For Rush, that meant some serious bow time with close friend Alex Hughey - on the hunt for some of the biggest snook we've ever encountered. The bite wasn't easy, but that didn't stop Rush from smashing his personal best - not once, but twice - in one unforgettable day on the water. Don't miss this action-packed episode of the Sea Safe adventure from beautiful Sebastian, Florida!

programme.title: Saltwater Experience

programme.title: Saltwater Experience

programme.title: Saltwater Experience

programme.title: Saltwater Experience

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: SoCal summer is calling, and the Local Knowledge crew is back on Alis home turf in San Diego, California. With reports of hot bites and fish moving in, the crew faces a classic Southern California dilemma chase big yellowtail around the Coronado Islands or head north in search of bluefin tuna. The options are plenty, the challenges are real, and thats exactly what keeps fishing in SoCal so exciting.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: Our final show highlights some of the best diving of the year.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float planea new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, the land of earth, sea, and sky. All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaskas abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. Therell be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for nowjoin usthere are halibut to filet, rainforest shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: South Africa offers an incredible insight into the hunter and gatherer history of ancestors. Dan Cabela re-traces the footsteps of humanity's forefathers and explores how modern, private ownership of land has helped re-balance the human relationship with nature.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green explores the 10,000 islands off the West Coast of Florida on his Sea-Doo while trying to catch fish after red tide. If the idea of camping off the grid, only eating what you catch, and discovering remains of thousand-year-old civilizations excites you, this is an episode you won't want to miss.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: In Episode 10 Boat Trader heads to central Texas to explore boating culture in the lone star state. Second only to Alaska in size, Texas is known as the place where everything is bigger. From big college football games to endless oil fields and vast wind farms, Texas is home to more than 30 million Americans. But the state is about more than just big oil, college football and cattle farms - it's also home to some of the best boating in the country. Boasting a myriad of waterways, boaters here enjoy hundreds of lakes, rivers and streams that provide recreational opportunities, abundant wildlife and plenty of fishing. From Austin Texas to San Antonio host Ryan McVinney and the Boat Trader crew explore the laid-back Texas lake life including boat up restaurants along the Colorado River, watersports in Austin and the history of the waterways throughout the region. Boat manufacturers highlighted in this episode are Tige Boats and ATX Surf Boats, two premium Texas-based wake boat brands known for their high-quality, cutting-edge vessels that come equipped with advanced wake shaping technologies and equipment ideal for water skiing, wake surfing and wakeboarding. There's even a wake surfing dog!

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: Host Ryan McVinney takes Boat Trader fans on an indepth exploration of Florida flats fishing deep in the backcountry of Islamorada. Featuring Captain Eric Lund, a Wall Street Broker turned backcountry fishing guide, this episode reveals the key design features of the worlds best flats skiffs and how they are built for targeting some of the most exciting sportfish species on the planet. Also, covered are bay boats and their versatility for families exploring Floridas coastal waterways, along with a detailed study of fish species and wildlife in the region. Some of the areas most beautiful and secret locales show why Islamorada has earned the nickname of the Sportfish Capital of The World.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team showcases structural fiberglass repairs and teak refinishing on various project boats, including non-skid walkway applications.

programme.desc: The story of the game changing 350 Legend cartridge is documented at deer camps across the midwest with the Keefer Brothers in Kansas, Mark and Terry Drury in Missouri, Melissa Bachman in Nebraska and Team Winchester back in Missouri.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: In our 100th episode we look back and detail a true labor of love. Discussing the fun and challenges learning and adapting to fishing & filming the amazing fishery surrounding Panama City Beach.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: PCBs white sand beaches are jam-packed with visitors soaking up sunand surf while Justin and Meredith chase schools of migrating tarponjust offshore. How often do those two worlds collide?

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green heads to Yankton, South Dakota to learn about the history of the Missouri river and the people who count on the river for sustenance. The invasive carp are set to destroy this rich ecosystem and Kyle aims to stop this fish with his best weapon, a great recipe.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with his friends at the National Wild Turkey Federation to dive into turkey conservation, and hunt the largest subspecies of wild turkey. Kyle finishes off this episode with his most favorite wild game recipe, boneless wild turkey wings.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green explores the 10,000 islands off the West Coast of Florida on his Sea-Doo while trying to catch fish after red tide. If the idea of camping off the grid, only eating what you catch, and discovering remains of thousand-year-old civilizations excites you, this is an episode you won't want to miss.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson set off to hunt the American Alligator in eastern Texas. A species that was placed on the endangered species list in the 1960s, their populations are now thriving. Kyle and Jeff have agreed to help remove some problem gators off private land owned by their friend Troy, but things get rowdy when Kyle loses a bet and has to swim with the very gators he is hunting.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It's 2016 and Mark heads down to Kansas for an early season Muzzleloader Whitetail hunt with Salt River Outfitters. It was hot in the stand with little deer movement until the moon phase switched and one of the bucks Mark had been looking for stepped out. Kansas is one of those states that has an early Muzzleloader season that opens in September, and if you can get the weather and the moon to align you can catch a big deer on his feet in daylight.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Follow along as Mark Peterson travels to Tanzania to hunt the Eastern and Western White-Bearded Wildebeest. These animals are known for their distinctive white beards and large horns, making them a sought-after trophy for hunters on an African safari. Mark sets out on an exciting and thrilling adventure to track down these elusive creatures in the plains of Tanzania.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Join Mark Peterson on an epic hunting adventure in the stunning landscapes of New Zealand as he goes after Whitetail deer. On this hunt, Mark was unable to get his firearms import permit in time to take his Gunwerks rifle, so he'd have to borrow a trusty rifle from his guide, Shawn. Get ready for heart-pounding action, breathtaking scenery, and valuable tips and tricks from a seasoned hunter.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is south of the border in Veracruz, Mexico going after a Mexican Gulf Coast Whitetail. When the whitetail action slowed down, Mark tried his luck at a spot-and stalk hunt for White-lipped Peccary. With hot temps, Mark and company try to find water that the Peccary will be targeting to stay hydrated.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark continues his quest in New Zealand, but this time, after a Wapiti. On this hunt, Mark was unable to get his firearms import permit in time to take his Gunwerks rifle, so he'd again have to borrow from his guide, Shawn. Elk were first introduced to New Zealand in 1909 when President Roosevelt gifted a herd of 20 animals that were released on the South Island. Get ready to immerse yourself in the beauty of nature that New Zealand has to offer.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: In this episode, Mark Peterson chases after a Red Stag, Black Buck and Fallow deer. Theres no shortage of action in this video. Argentina's borders were closed during the peak of COVID, so these animals have not been hunted for two years, which led to a game rich environment and excellent trophy quality. On this adventure, Mark is joined by his dad Earl, brother Aaron and nephew Alec to chase some of the biggest free-range Red Stags in the world. Stay tuned for more on this family adventure in Argentina.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson sets his sights on a Free-Range New Zealand Red Stag, but it doesn't come easy. Dense fog, steep terrain, and thick vegetation make finding a mature stag no easy task. Watch as Mark Peterson and his guide cover the gorgeous New Zealand landscape in search of one of the most sought-after big game animals on the South Island of New Zealand. On this hunt, Mark was unable to get his firearms import permit in time to take his Gunwerks rifle, so he'd again have to borrow from his guide.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark's quest for the South America Waterfowl Slam has now taken him to Peru where he finds a surprising density of Cinnamon Teal. Although he already checked this species off the list in Argentina, his first hunt in Peru proves to be one of the best Cinnamon Teal shoots of his life. This is only the first afternoon and there are 5 days left to hunt the remaining 7 species.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP finds the Largemouth Bass keyed into only one specific pattern this mid fall day.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP heads back into Florida Bay with Captain Richard Black in search of Redfish, Snook and whatever else they run into using all artificial baits.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP Heads to the Dot Lawrence River to target Springtime Smallmouth Bass on small Swimbaits.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP Works with a BFS (Bait Finesse System) to cast micro crankbaits for pre-spawn Smallmouth Bass.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Pentecost sets up a new stand on a creek crossing in Illinois that had been scouted for the past two years. It always heated up as the season progressed, and on his very first morning sit, the action unfolded fast. A good buck came cruising from the South in search of a doe. At 60 yards he started to turn away, but the Intimidator grunt call changed everything. With a few calls from the Intimidator, he spun around from 150 yards, worked a scrape at 40 yards, and walked right into range!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten & Mark Scroggins is in Oklahoma during the peak rut, chasing mature whitetail bucks! With bucks on the move and searching for does, it's the perfect time to break out the calls. Watch as Mark and Colten pull out all the stopsgetting aggressively loud with the WoodHaven "Intimidator" Grunt Callto turn a cruising buck and bring him right into bow range at the blind.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jacob Pentecost and Easton Thompson head to Illinois for the youth hunting season. With hot weather and slow deer movement, the hunt proves to be a challenge. After days of patience and persistence, Jacob finally gets the opportunity to fill his tag!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Hunsucker of Heartland Bowhunter returns to a familiar ranch hes helped manage for years, chasing a legendary buck nicknamed Buddy.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: In Missouri, we join Avery Epperson on the home farm with one goal in mindcatching up with a legendary buck known as Old Monroe. It doesnt take long before the hunt heats up as the crew spots their target and works to grunt him into bow range. Hunting over a lush green plot on the home farm, Avery gets the chance every whitetail hunter dreams of.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jake Huebschman with The Hunting Public is in Iowa during the rut when he spots a mature buck locked down with a doe. Jake decides to get aggressive, closing the distance and mimicking an intruder buck to trigger a response. Watch as the plan unfolds in real time, showing how bold moves can pay off when hunting pressured whitetails.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: After purchasing his very first Kansas farm, Shawn and his good friend Cole set out to transform it into a true whitetail paradise. Years of hard work, dedication, and habitat improvement finally pay off when Shawn takes on a challenge hes never faced beforeharvesting a whitetail buck on the ground with no blind! Filming adds another layer of difficulty, but the reward is more than worth it. In an unforgettable hunt, Shawn is able to harvest a giant 9.5-year-old Kansas buck, making this a once-in-a-lifetime experience.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Long time friends Mike and Danny find a hot top water bite.

programme.title: Reel Animals

programme.title: Reel Animals

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA heads to the space coast for a mixed bag of drum.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA fishes the ultra shallow ponds in Flagler beach for reds and snook.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: Tanner and CA put their power fishing skills to the ultimate test.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA heads to Jupiter to fish with Ryan Nitz for giant snook.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Capt. Jonathan Moss is in Flamingo, Everglades National Park, in search of silver and gold.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: From Miami to Apalachicola Bay, Florida, Capt. Jonathan Moss revisits some of his favorite moments from this season.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss and Captain James Hillman are heading out of Highland Park Fish Camp in Deland, Florida, looking for largemouth bass.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss is fishing the South Carolina low country with Captain Stephen Flook Jr. The weather is cold and windy, but the plan remains the same, FULL SEND!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: With Montana in the rearview mirror the Flylords team crosses over into Idaho. In this leg of the trip they hit Blue-Ribbon trout waters with the folks from Henrys Fork Anglers and Silver Creek Outfitters. They also have a chance to sit down with the owners of these operations and hear what these shops and fly fishing mean to them. Before they hit the road to Utah the crew joins in on another conservation event at Payette Brewing Company.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Its the final leg of the Fly Shop Tour and what better way to end it than with a trip down to see the crew at Fly Fish Food. We learn the unique story of how owners Clark Cheech Pierce & Curtis Fry started their shop and spend some time chasing hungry Cutthroat. Wrapping it all up the team puts on the final conservation event of the season with Fly Fish Food and Fish For Garbage, as well as spending some time behind the oars on the Green River with crew at Western Rivers Fly Shop.

programme.title: Bonefish & Tarpon Trust
programme.desc: Watch the video to learn more about bonefish and tarpon connectivity and the importance of conservation at local and regional levels.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jeff & Cole of Buckventures TV, are back in Oklahoma with one big goalcatching up with the buck they call That 170. With a cold front rolling in, they waste no time hanging stands and getting in position for the action. Jeff breaks out the WoodHaven Intimidator grunt call and sets the stage with a decoy, hoping to pull the giant into bow range.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten Scroggins and the whole family return to the blind to see if they can call one of the other gobblers back in to their setup. A family that hunts together stays together!

programme.desc: Massive wildfires had consumed thousands of acres across the Bighorn Mountains and the neighboring foothills. Would the annual HuntStand pronghorn camp be a total bust, or would the crew be able to find a few animals beyond the smoke?

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor

programme.title: Local Knowledge

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: It might be cold and windy, but if you have trust in your guide the result could be an epic day of fishing! Rush steps up to the challenge and puts Ali on an incredible bite of mutton snapper while also checking another species off of Ali's bucket list!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As season 8 comes to a close, Ali and Rush reflect on some of the more memorable moments on the water. From the Florida Keys to San Diego, Guatemala, and the Bahamas, the show has taken us on quite the adventures with more to come!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the local Key West ship wrecks covered in Permit, Rush takes good friend and marine artist KC Scott fishing for "inspiration." While permit is the plan, the boys stay rigged and ready for the numerous species the Florida Keys may deliver when fishing offshore.

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament

programme.desc: The 2022 season kicks off with Qualifier 1 on the Bay of Quinte out of Trenton, Ontario. This event is a Largemouth only event

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: Qualifier 2 has the BaitFuel Fishing Tour Teams converging on Morrisburg, Ontario on the St. Lawrence River

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Join Dan Cabela as he travels across Argentina to see how scientists and hunters are working together. From region-wide bird surveys to the incredible conservation work being done on the critically endangered huemul deer, this beautiful country has no shortage of fascinating stories.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela is on a mission to better understand how wild-harvested protein contributes economically and culturally to society in North America. Join him as he learns more about the Wild Harvest Initiative and sets out to harvest his own food for the freezer.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Travelling to Vancouver Island, Dan Cabela meets with tribal leader Chief Cootes to learn more about how the careful management of black bears offers economic benefits while maintaining cultural importance to his community.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Famous for its Mayan ruins, the Yucatan in Mexico is home to a diverse array of wildlife. After years of over-harvesting and exploitation, regulated hunting is helping to conserve large areas of this fragile ecosystem. Dan Cabela travels to the region to find out more.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: While releasing a defeated tarpon healthy after an epic battle is the ultimate victory, everything else is measured in heartbreak and degrees of failure. For Justin, putting Ethan on his first silver king requires patience and a tasty diversion by a local chef.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith learns the value of the Trash Can Slam on a flounder trip withCapt. Justin that turns into a multi-species challenge.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin Leake and Meredith McCord divert attention from whats not happening with the tarpon bite to using CoastMaster, light tackle and experience to find snapper success on heavily fished public spots.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When the Bay Point Billfish Open returns, we hop on board the Ellie B for some offshore competition and follow the events epic dockside party.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The LK crew returns to Guatemala with more friends for our yearly dose of world class fishing! Year after year, Casa Vieja Lodge continues to impress with daily shots at sailfish, marlin, mahi, and tuna. Tag along on our 2nd annual group trip for a tropical fishing experience like no other!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Heavy hearts find comfort in cherished memories as the Local Knowledge crew mourns the loss of one of the greatest members of the fishing industry. Looking back on several of our episodes with our dear friend Dave Salazar, we celebrate the life of this amazing fishermen, family man, and visionary behind the world renowned Casa Vieja Lodge.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Odyssea Sportfishing family grows as Casey Villone comes aboard as Rush's new deck hand. While Rush gained a helping hand on his charters, he also scored a new "Fishing Mate" who is always game to bend a rod. With a day off and a report of Tuna offshore, the two head out to see if they can beat the sharks and land a Key West sushi dinner.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush teams up with longtime friend and fellow angler Jesus Diaz for a well-earned "busman's holiday" in the beautiful waters of Key West. Even on a day off, these two can't resist seeing what's going to bite. Taking the wind and the tides into account, the duo maps out a strategic circuit through Key West's surrounding waters to target cobia, grouper, snapper, and tuna for a busy day "off" work.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Water quality is everythingand the Star brite - SeaSafe team is back at it for the second year in a row! Led by Cory Redwine, Conservation Director of Project SeaSafe, this is the 4th Annual Clean Water Collective and its bigger than ever. This time, were in Grant, Florida, where 4 million clams are being released into the Indian River Lagoon, paired with the planting of thousands of mangroves, oyster work by CCA and trash clean ups to help restore one of Floridas most critical ecosystems. But its not just about hard workits about connection. With local captains, fishing legends, and the Local Knowledge crew on hand, we hit the water to show why this place is worth fighting for. From clam drops by drone, to in-water mangrove planting, to monster snook catches, this is hands-on conservation at its best. This two-part series kicks off with action, heart, and the kind of hope only a healthy waterway can bring. Dont miss Part 1where conservation meets community and everyone gets their hands wet.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As part of this year's Star brite Sea Safe event, we hit the water to experience some of the incredible fishing the Indian River Lagoon has to offer. For Rush, that meant some serious bow time with close friend Alex Hughey - on the hunt for some of the biggest snook we've ever encountered. The bite wasn't easy, but that didn't stop Rush from smashing his personal best - not once, but twice - in one unforgettable day on the water. Don't miss this action-packed episode of the Sea Safe adventure from beautiful Sebastian, Florida!

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Rich's son Reed, who takes the wheel and directs the team into some amazing early morning baby tarpon fishing in the Everglades.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor take Hunter Smallback into the Everglades for some snook fishing, and the action really heats up when some hungry Lemon sharks crash the party.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor catch two thirds of a slam when they bring Toms new Yellowfin 24 Bay up to Key Largo for some exciting flats fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Captain Mason Baker to sample some early morning Islamorada backcountry baby tarpon action.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: After a successful morning of baby tarpon fishing, Captains Tom Rowland, Rich Tudor and Mason Baker slide over to the legendary downtown Islamorada flats to check on the resurgence of Florida Keys bonefish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head into the Everglades backcountry out of Key Largo to fish the shallow grass flats for tailing redfish.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When the Bay Point Billfish Open returns, we hop on board the Ellie B for some offshore competition and follow the events epic dockside party.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: SoCal summer is calling, and the Local Knowledge crew is back on Alis home turf in San Diego, California. With reports of hot bites and fish moving in, the crew faces a classic Southern California dilemma chase big yellowtail around the Coronado Islands or head north in search of bluefin tuna. The options are plenty, the challenges are real, and thats exactly what keeps fishing in SoCal so exciting.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through the mountains of western North Carolina, where we stop in Asheville and Cashiers!!

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: Our final show highlights some of the best diving of the year.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float planea new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, the land of earth, sea, and sky. All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaskas abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. Therell be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for nowjoin usthere are halibut to filet, rainforest shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: South Africa offers an incredible insight into the hunter and gatherer history of ancestors. Dan Cabela re-traces the footsteps of humanity's forefathers and explores how modern, private ownership of land has helped re-balance the human relationship with nature.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green explores the 10,000 islands off the West Coast of Florida on his Sea-Doo while trying to catch fish after red tide. If the idea of camping off the grid, only eating what you catch, and discovering remains of thousand-year-old civilizations excites you, this is an episode you won't want to miss.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: In Episode 10 Boat Trader heads to central Texas to explore boating culture in the lone star state. Second only to Alaska in size, Texas is known as the place where everything is bigger. From big college football games to endless oil fields and vast wind farms, Texas is home to more than 30 million Americans. But the state is about more than just big oil, college football and cattle farms - it's also home to some of the best boating in the country. Boasting a myriad of waterways, boaters here enjoy hundreds of lakes, rivers and streams that provide recreational opportunities, abundant wildlife and plenty of fishing. From Austin Texas to San Antonio host Ryan McVinney and the Boat Trader crew explore the laid-back Texas lake life including boat up restaurants along the Colorado River, watersports in Austin and the history of the waterways throughout the region. Boat manufacturers highlighted in this episode are Tige Boats and ATX Surf Boats, two premium Texas-based wake boat brands known for their high-quality, cutting-edge vessels that come equipped with advanced wake shaping technologies and equipment ideal for water skiing, wake surfing and wakeboarding. There's even a wake surfing dog!

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: Host Ryan McVinney takes Boat Trader fans on an indepth exploration of Florida flats fishing deep in the backcountry of Islamorada. Featuring Captain Eric Lund, a Wall Street Broker turned backcountry fishing guide, this episode reveals the key design features of the worlds best flats skiffs and how they are built for targeting some of the most exciting sportfish species on the planet. Also, covered are bay boats and their versatility for families exploring Floridas coastal waterways, along with a detailed study of fish species and wildlife in the region. Some of the areas most beautiful and secret locales show why Islamorada has earned the nickname of the Sportfish Capital of The World.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team showcases structural fiberglass repairs and teak refinishing on various project boats, including non-skid walkway applications.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and Alex explore the SS United States; the worlds largest artificial reef.
